Dialogue: One thing about my mom... she always plans ahead.

Dialogue: Excellent.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah, I thought you'd like this place.

Dialogue: Yeah.  I'm gonna wait till dark to cross the border.  Enrique, it's dangerous for you here.  You get out tonight, too, okay?

Dialogue: Yeah, Saralita.  Sure.  Just drop by any time and totally fuck up my life.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: See, I grew up in places like this, so I just thought it was how people lived... riding around in helicopters.  Learning how to blow shit up.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Then, when Mom got busted I got put in a regular school.  The other kids were, like, into Nintendo.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Are you ever afraid?

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Not even of dying?

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You don't feel any emotion about it one way or the other?

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: No.  I have to stay functional until my mission is complete.  Then it doesn't matter.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah.  I have to stay functional too.  "I'm too important".

Speaker: john
Dialogue: It's definitely you.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: There was this one guy that was kinda cool. He taught me engines.  Hold this a second.  Mom screwed it up, of course.  Sooner or later she'd always tell them about Judgment Day and me being this world leader and that's be all she wrote.

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: Torque wrench please.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Here.  I wish I coulda met my real dad.

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: You will.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Yeah.  I guess so.  My mom says when I'm, like, 45, I think, I send him back through time to 1984.  But right now he hasn't even been born yet.  Man, is messes with your head.  Where's that other bolt?  Thanks.  Mom and him were only together for one night, but she still loves him, I guess.  I see her crying sometimes.  She denies it totally, of course.  Like she says she got something in her eye.

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: Why do you cry?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: You mean people?  I don't know.  We just cry. You know.  When it hurts.

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: Pain causes it?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Uh-unh, no, it's different... It's when there's nothing wrong with you but you hurt anyway.  You get it?

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Alriight!!  My man!

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: No problemo.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: ... if we are ever separated, and can't make contact, go to Enrique's airstrip.  I'll rendezvous with you there.

Dialogue: Howdy.  I saw you pulled over here earlier. Everything okay?

Speaker: salceda
Dialogue: She said you go south with him...  ... tonight, like you planned.  She will meet you tomorrow in...

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Mommm!! Wait!!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: "No fate."  No fate but what we make.  My father told her this... I mean I made him memorize it, up in the future, as a message to her -- Never mind.  Okay, the whole thing goes "The future is not set.  There is no fate but what we make for ourselves."

Dialogue: She intends to change the future somehow.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I guess, yeah --  Oh shit!!

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: Dyson.

Dialogue: Yeah, gotta be!  Miles Dyson!  She's gonna blow him away!

Dialogue: Come on.  Let's go.  LET'S GO!!

Dialogue: This is tactically dangerous.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Drive faster.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I don't care.  We've gotta stop her.

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: Killing Dyson might actually prevent the war.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I don't care!! There's gotta be another way. Haven't you learned anything?!  Haven't you figured out why you can't kill people?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Look, maybe you don't care if you live or die. But everybody's not like that!  Okay?!  We have feelings.  We hurt.  We're afraid.  You gotta learn this stuff, man, I'm not kidding.  It's important.

Dialogue: Run, kids!  Go!  Run!

Speaker: tarissa
Dialogue: Miles!  Oh my God!!

Speaker: miles
Dialogue: Stay back!!

Dialogue: Shit, we're too late!

Dialogue: Danny!  DANNY!

Speaker: danny
Dialogue: Daaaaddddeeee!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Don't fucking move!  Don't FUCKING MOVE!!  Get on the floor, bitch!  Now!!  Fucking down! NOW!!

Speaker: blythe
Dialogue: Don't hurt my father!

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Shut up, kid!  Get out of the way!!

Speaker: dyson
Dialogue: Please... let... the kids... go...

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Shut up!  SHUT UP!!  Motherfucker!  It's all your fault!  IT'S YOUR FAULT!!

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Mom?  You okay?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I couldn't... oh, God.  You... came here... to stop me?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Uh huh.

Dialogue: It's okay.  It'll by okay.  We'll figure it out.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: I love you, John.  I always have.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: I know, Mom.  I know.

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: Clean penetration.  No shattered bone. Compression should control the loss of blood.

Dialogue: Do you have bandages?

Speaker: dyson
Dialogue: In the bathroom.  Danny, can you get them for us?

Dialogue: Who are you people?

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Show him.

Speaker: dyson
Dialogue: My God.

Speaker: terminator
Dialogue: Now listen to me very carefully.

Speaker: dyson
Dialogue: I feel like I'M gonna throw up.

Speaker: dyson
Dialogue: You're judging me on thing's I haven't even done yet.  Jesus.  How were we supposed to know?

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Yeah.  Right.  How were you supposed to know? Fucking men... all you know how to do is thrust into the world with your... fucking ideas and your weapons.  Did you know that every gun in the world is named after a man?  Colt, Browning, Smith, Thompson, Kalashnikov... all men.  Men built the hydrogen bomb, not women... men like you thought it up.  You're so creative.  You don't know what it's like to really create something... to create a life.  To feel it growing inside you.  All you know how to create is death... you fucking bastards.

Speaker: john
Dialogue: Mom, Mom, we need to be more constructive here. I don't see this as a gender-related issue.  We still have to figure out how to stop it all from happening.  Right?

Speaker: tarissa
Dialogue: But I thought... aren't we changing things?  I mean... right now?  Changing the way it goes?

Dialogue: That's not good enough.

Dialogue: No one must follow your work.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Son of a bitch, I knew it!

Dialogue: They told us not to ask where they got it.  I thought... Japan... hell, I don't know.  I didn't want to know.

Speaker: sarah
Dialogue: Those lying motherfuckers!

Speaker: dyson
Dialogue: I was scary stuff, radically advanced.  It was shattered... didn't work.  But it gave us ideas, It took us in new directions... things we would never have thought of.  All this work is based on it.

Dialogue: I think so, yeah.  When?

Dialogue: Now?  Yeah, right.

Dialogue: No good.

Dialogue: Let me try mine.

Dialogue: John!  Fire-in-the-hole!

Dialogue: Here!

Dialogue: Give me that thing a second.

Dialogue: I've worked for years on this thing.
